cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Yucatán, then turning north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf of Mexico with a likely strike on the southwest Louisiana coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Louisiana coast near Cameron/Lake Charles

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in force yet (watches expected to be issued Wednesday for the northern Gulf Coast).
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in force yet (warnings expected later).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana and Mississippi coasts.
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (38% cumulative) for sustained 50-kt winds with potential hurricane-force gusts at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge possible; values of 6–9 ft above ground could penetrate Calcasieu Lake and surrounding lowlands.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 in with isolated totals up to 12 in could produce flash and urban flooding around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of landfall.
